title: Photosynthesis

title: Photosynthesis
subject: Science
text_content: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants make food using sunlight. This process uses carbon dioxide and water, producing oxygen as a byproduct.

quiz.question: Which gas is used in photosynthesis?
quiz.explanation: Plants absorb carbon dioxide and release oxygen during photosynthesis.

quiz.question: What is required for photosynthesis?
quiz.explanation: Solar energy drives the photosynthesis process.

title: Indian Constitution
subject: Civics
text_content: भारतीय संविधान भारत का सर्वोच्च कानून है जो नागरिकों के मौलिक अधिकारों को निर्धारित करता है। यह 26 जनवरी 1950 को लागू हुआ था।

quiz.question: भारतीय संविधान कब लागू हुआ?
quiz.explanation: भारतीय संविधान 26 जनवरी 1950 को लागू हुआ, जिसे हम गणतंत्र दिवस के रूप में मनाते हैं।

title: Indian Constitution
subject: Civics
text_content: The Indian Constitution is the supreme law of India that establishes fundamental rights for citizens. It came into effect on January 26, 1950.

quiz.question: When did the Indian Constitution come into effect?
quiz.explanation: The Indian Constitution came into effect on January 26, 1950, celebrated as Republic Day.

title: Pythagorean Theorem
subject: Mathematics
